Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • com.jogamp.opengl.awt.GLCanvas
          • Canvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Canvas
extends com.jogamp.opengl.awt.GLCanvas
implements com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener
    Based on :http://www3.ntu.edu.sg/home/ehchua/programming/opengl/JOGL2.0.html with minor modifications JOGL 2.0 Program Template (GLCanvas) This is a "Component" which can be added into a top-level "Container". It also handles the OpenGL events to render graphics.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • init

        public void init​(com.jogamp.opengl.GLAutoDrawable drawable)
        Overridden method from the one declared in GLEventListener.

        init() runs on the creation of the canvas, this is where we can declare mouse and key listeners and other control methods.

        Specified by:
        init in interface com.jogamp.opengl.GLEventListener
        Parameters:
        drawable - A GLAutoDrawable that calls the rendering functions

        1.0

                    int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Overridden method from the one declared in GLEventListener.

        reshape() runs on the resizing of the canvas, this is where we adjust variables to be compatible with the new window size.

        Specified by:
